section.heading: Power to hold property; title to trust property.
section.text: A statutory trust may hold or take title to property in its own name or in the name of a trustee in the trustee’s capacity as trustee, whether in an active, passive, or custodial capacity.

annoGroup.heading: Editor's Notes
annoGroup.annotation: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 307 of the Uniform Statutory Trust Entity Act.
